name: Termination of membership
text:
(a)  Except as otherwise provided by section 88-96, any member absent from service for four calendar years following the calendar year in which the member's employment terminated shall cease to be a member, and the former member's credited service shall be forfeited.
     (b)  Any member who withdraws the member's contributions, becomes a retirant, or dies, ceases to be a member as of the date of withdrawal, retirement, or death. [L 1969, c 110, pt of §1; am L 1971, c 90, §1; gen ch 1985; am L 1998, c 151, §4; am L 2006, c 169, §§7, 8; am L 2008, c 47, §8]
 
Note
 
  L 2008, c 47, §16 provides:
  "SECTION 16.  Sections 8 and 9 of this Act [amending sections 88-61 and 88-73] shall not be applied to affect the rights of any retirants, as defined in section 88-21, Hawaii Revised Statutes, who retired prior to the effective date of this Act [October 1, 2008], or rights of the beneficiaries or survivors of those retirants."
